  9573                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9574                                  
  9575                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9576                                  
  9577                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9578                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9579                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9580                                  ;
  9581                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9582                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9583                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9584                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9585                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9586                                  ;
  9587                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9588                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9589                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9590                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9591                                  
  9592                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9593 000004CE E84A00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9594 000004D1 8B36[E904]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9595                                  
  9596                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9597                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9598                                  ;
  9599                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9600                                  ;	       ----------------
  9601                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9602                                  ;
  9603                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9604                                  ;
  9605                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9606                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9607                                  ;		1,193,180
  9608                                  ;
  9609                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9610                                  ;
  9611                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9612                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9613                                  ;		59,659
  9614                                  ;
  9615                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9616                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9617                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9618                                  ;
  9619                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9620                                  ; multiply by 5
  9621                                  
  9622 000004D5 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9623 000004D7 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9624                                  					; multiply by 5
  9625 000004D9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9626 000004DB D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9627 000004DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9628 000004DF D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9629 000004E1 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9630 000004E3 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9631 000004E5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9632                                  
  9633                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9634                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9635                                  
  9636 000004E6 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9637 000004E9 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9638                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9639                                  
  9640                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9641                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9642 000004EB 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9643 000004EC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9644 000004EE F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9645                                  
  9646                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9647                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9648                                  
  9649 000004F0 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9650 000004F2 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9651                                  
  9652                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9653                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9654                                  
  9655 000004F5 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9656 000004F7 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9657 000004FA 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9658 000004FC 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9659                                  noadj:					
  9660 000004FF F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9661 00000500 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9662                                  
  9663                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9664                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9665                                  
  9666 00000502 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9667 00000504 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9668 00000506 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9669                                  		;mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9670                                  		; 20/12/2023
  9671 00000508 B13C                    		mov	cl, 60
  9672 0000050A F7F1                    		div	cx
  9673 0000050C 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9674 0000050E F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9675 00000510 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9676                                  
  9677                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9678                                  
  9679                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9680                                  		;push	ax
  9681                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9682 00000512 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9683 00000513 AB                      		stosw
  9684                                  		;pop	ax
  9685 00000514 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9686 00000515 AB                      		stosw
  9687 00000516 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9688 00000518 AB                      		stosw
  9689 00000519 F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9690                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9691                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9692                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9693                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9694 0000051A C3                      		retn
  9695                                  
  9696                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9697                                  
  9698                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9699                                  
  9700                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9701                                  ;
  9702                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9703                                  ;
  9704                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9705                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9706                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9707                                  ;
  9708                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9709                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9710                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9711                                  ;			else
  9712                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9713                                  ;		}
  9714                                  ;
  9715                                  ; USES : AX
  9716                                  ;
  9717                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9718                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9719                                  ;
  9720                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9721                                  
  9722                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9723                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9724 0000051B 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9725 0000051D CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9726                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9727                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9728                                  					; midnight
  9729                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9730                                  		; 20/12/2023
  9731 0000051F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9732 00000521 3826[EB04]              		cmp	byte [t_switch], ah ; 0
  9733                                  		;cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9734 00000525 7505                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9735                                  		;xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9736                                  					; and not flag
  9737 00000527 0106[E904]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9738 0000052B C3                      		retn
  9739                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9740                                  
  9741                                  inc_case:
  9742 0000052C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9743 0000052E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9744 00000530 FF06[E904]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9745                                  no_rollover:
  9746 00000534 C3                      		retn
  9747

  9775                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9776                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9777                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9778                                  
  9779                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9780                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9781                                  
  9782                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9783                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9784                                  
  9785                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9786                                  
  9787                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9788                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9789                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9790                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9791                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9792                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9793                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9794                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9795                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9796                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9797                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9798                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9799                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9800                                  
  9801                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9802                                  
  9803                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9804                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9805                                  ;
  9806                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9807                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9808                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9809                                  ;   else
  9810                                  ;	set slow = value
  9811                                  ;   ...
  9812                                  ;*********************************************
  9813                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9814                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9815                                  ;*	 use slow
  9816                                  ;*   else
  9817                                  ;*	 use fast
  9818                                  ;*********************************************
  9819                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9820                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9821                                  ;	use slow
  9822                                  ;   else
  9823                                  ;	use fast
  9824                                  ;   ...
  9825                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9826                                  ;
  9827                                  ;
  9828                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9829                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9830                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9831                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9832                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9833                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9834                                  
  9835                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9836                                  
  9837                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9838                                  
  9839                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9840                                  
  9841                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9842                                  ;	command jump table
  9843                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9844                                  
  9845                                  		; 20/12/2023
  9846                                  		;db 0
  9847                                  ; 11/12/2022
  9848                                  %if 0
  9849                                  
  9850                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9851                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  9852                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init
  9853                                  		dw 4EBh			; media_chk
  9854                                  		dw 592h			; get_bpb
  9855                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9856                                  		dw 857h			; dsk_read
  9857                                  		dw 83Dh			; x_bus_exit
  9858                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9859                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9860                                  		dw 849h			; dsk_writ
  9861                                  		dw 841h			; dsk_writv
  9862                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9863                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9864                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9865                                  		dw 80Ah			; dsk_open

  9915                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9916                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9917                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9918                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9919                                  ;
  9920                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9921                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9922                                  
  9923                                  SetDrive:

  9926                                  X_Scan_Loop:

  9928 00000572 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv

  9930 00000577 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9931 0000057A 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9932 0000057C F9                      		stc

  9934 0000057D C3                      		retn

  9939                                  
  9940                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9941                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9942                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9943                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9944                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed

  9976                                  
  9977                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9978                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9979                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.

 10030                                  
 10031                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10032                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 10033                                  ; drive.
 10034                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 10035                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 10036                                  ; returns in si:
 10037                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 10038                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 10039                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 10040                                  ;
 10041                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 10042                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10043                                  
 10044                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10045                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 10046 000005F0 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 10047 000005F3 E825FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 10048 000005F6 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 10049                                  					; get stored time
 10050 000005FA 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 10051 000005FC 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 10052 00000600 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 10053                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10054                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 10055                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 10056 00000602 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 10057 00000604 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 10058 00000606 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 10059                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10060                                  		;inc	al
 10061                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 10062                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 10063                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10064                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 10065                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 10066                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 10067                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10068                                  		;dec	al
 10069                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 10070                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10071 00000608 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 10072 0000060D 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 10073 0000060F FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10074 00000613 C3                      		retn
 10075                                  
 10076                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10077                                  
 10078                                  timepassed:
 10079 00000614 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
 10080                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 10081 00000617 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 10082                                  
 10083                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
 10084                                  timecheck_unk:				
 10085 00000619 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
 10086                                  timecheck_ret:

 10088                                  		;mov	[accesscount], al
 10089 0000061A C3                      		retn

 10166                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10167                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 10168                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 10169                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 10170                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 10171                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 10172                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 10173                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
 10174                                  ;
 10175                                  ;	trashes si, cx
 10176                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10177                                  
 10178                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 10179                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 10180                                  
 10181                                  ; 11/09/2023
 10182                                  ; 14/08/2023

 10186                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)

 10188                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
 10189                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)
 10190 00000668 57                      		push	di
 10191 00000669 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx		; no serial number
 10192 0000066B 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10193 0000066F 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10194                                  
 10195                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
 10196                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
 10197                                  		; merging them... jgl
 10198                                  
 10199                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL

 10202

 10204 00000675 BE[0E05]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
 10205 00000678 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10206 0000067B F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10207                                  		
 10208                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 10209                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 10210                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 10211                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 10212                                  
 10213                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 10214                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 10215                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 10216                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 10217                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 10218                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 10219                                  			;
 10220                                  			; Correct Code:
 10221                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 10222                                  			; 11/09/2023
 10223                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 10224                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 10225                                  			;
 10226                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 10227                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 10228                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 10229                                  			;
 10230                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 10231                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 10232                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 10233                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 10234                                  
 10235 0000067D A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 10236                                  		
 10237                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"
 10238 0000067F BE[0505]                		mov	si, fat_16_id	; 19/10/2022

 10241 00000684 BE[FC04]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022
 10242                                  ci_bigfat:				
 10243                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10244                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10245 00000687 B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8 
 10246 00000689 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10247                                  					; filesys_id field

 10256                                  
 10257                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10258                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10259                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10260                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10261                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10262                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10263                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10264                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10265                                  ;
 10266                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10267                                  ;
 10268                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10269                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10270                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10271                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10272                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10273                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10274                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10275                                  ;
 10276                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10277                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10278                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10279                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10280                                  
 10281                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10282                                  GetBp:		
 10283                                  		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 10284                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable

 10475                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10476                                  
 10477                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10478                                  
 10479                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10480                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10481                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10482                                  ;
 10483                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10484                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10485                                  
 10486                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10487                                  
 10488                                  readbootsec:	
 10489 00000740 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10490 00000742 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10491 00000745 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10492 00000748 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10493 0000074A 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10494                                  
 10495                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10496                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10497                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10498                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10499                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10500                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10501                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10502                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10503                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10504                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10505                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10506                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10507                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10508                                  		; informations
 10509                                  
 10510                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10511                                  
 10512                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10513                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10514                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10515                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10516                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10517                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10518                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10519                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10520                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10521                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10522                                  
 10523                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10524 0000074C A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10525 0000074F 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10526 00000751 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10527                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10528 00000753 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10529 00000755 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10530                                  					; no need for nop
 10531 00000757 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10532 00000759 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10533 0000075B 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10534 00000760 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10535                                  
 10536                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10537                                  ;
 10538                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10539                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10540                                  ;;
 10541                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10542                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10543                                  ;;
 10544                                  ;;check_signature:
 10545                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10546                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10547                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10548                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10549                                  
 10550                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10551                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10552                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10553                                  
 10554                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10555                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 10556 00000762 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10557                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10558 00000765 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10559 00000766 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10560 00000768 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10561 0000076A 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10562 0000076B 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10563                                  
 10564                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10565                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10566                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10567                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10568                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10569                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10570                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10571                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10572                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10573                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10574                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10575                                  
 10576                                  checksinglesided:
 10577                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10578                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10579                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10580 0000076D 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10581 0000076F 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10582 00000771 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10583 00000773 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10584 00000775 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10585 0000077B 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10586 0000077D 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10587 00000782 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10588                                  
 10589                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10590                                  
 10591                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10592 00000784 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10593                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10594 00000789 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10595                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10596                                  
 10597                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10598 0000078B 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10599                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10600                                  movbpb_ret:
 10601                                  gooddsk:				
 10602 0000078C F8                      		clc
 10603                                  err_ret:
 10604 0000078D C3                      		retn

 10606                                  
 10607                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10608                                  ;err_ret:				
 10609                                  		;retn

 10611                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10612                                  
 10613                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10614                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10615                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10616                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10617                                  ;
 10618                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10619                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10620                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10621                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10622                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10623                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10624                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10625                                  
 10626                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10627                                  
 10628                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10629                                  movbpb:	
 10630 0000078E 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10631                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10632                                  					; sectors per unit
 10633 00000792 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10634                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10635                                  					; number of directory entries
 10636 00000796 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10637                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10638                                  					; size of drive
 10639 0000079A 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10640                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10641                                  					; media	descriptor
 10642 0000079E A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10643                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10644                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10645 000007A1 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10646                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10647                                  					; sectors per track
 10648 000007A5 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10649                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10650                                  					; number of heads
 10651 000007A9 803E[FB04]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10652 000007AE 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10653 000007B0 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10654 000007B3 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10655 000007B5 C606[FB04]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10656                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10657 000007BA 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10658 000007BF 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10659 000007C1 E89411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10660                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10661                                  		; cf = 0
 10662                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10663                                  		;clc
 10664 000007C4 C3                      		retn
 10665                                  
 10666                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10667                                  
 10668                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10669                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10670                                  ;by es:di.
 10671                                  
 10672                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10673                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10674                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10675                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10676                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10677                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10678                                  
 10679                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10680                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10681 000007C5 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10682                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10683                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10684 000007CA 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10685 000007CC 51                      		push	cx
 10686 000007CD 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10687                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]

 10724                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10725                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10726                                  ; input : es:di -> bds

 10729                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit

 10739 00000802 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret

 10744                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10745                                  
 10746                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10747                                  
 10748                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10749                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10750                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10751                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10752                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10753                                  ;		dh has head
 10754                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10755                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10756                                  ;
 10757                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10758                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10759                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10760                                  ;
 10761                                  ;		carry set
 10762                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10763                                  ;
 10764                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10765                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10766                                  
 10767                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10768                                  
 10769                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10770                                  read_sector:	
 10771 00000807 55                      		push	bp
 10772 00000808 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10773 0000080B 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10774 0000080F BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10775                                  rd_ret:					
 10776 00000812 06                      		push	es
 10777 00000813 1E                      		push	ds
 10778 00000814 07                      		pop	es
 10779 00000815 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10780 00000818 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10781                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10782                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10783                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10784 0000081A 07                      		pop	es
 10785 0000081B 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10786                                  rd_rty:					
 10787 0000081D E86504                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10788 00000820 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10789 00000822 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10790                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10791                                  					; fnon_removable
 10792 00000827 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10793 00000829 803E[2706]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10794 0000082E 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10795 00000830 50                      		push	ax
 10796 00000831 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10797 00000832 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10798                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10799                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10800                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10801                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10802 00000836 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10803 00000838 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10804                                  		; 
 10805 0000083B 1F                      		pop	ds
 10806 0000083C A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10807 0000083F 58                      		pop	ax
 10808                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10809 00000840 06                      		push	es
 10810 00000841 1E                      		push	ds
 10811 00000842 07                      		pop	es
 10812 00000843 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10813 00000846 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10814                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10815                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10816                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10817 00000848 07                      		pop	es
 10818 00000849 9C                      		pushf
 10819 0000084A 803E[2706]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10820 0000084F 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10821 00000851 50                      		push	ax
 10822 00000852 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10823 00000855 1E                      		push	ds
 10824 00000856 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10825 0000085A 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10826 0000085D 1F                      		pop	ds
 10827 0000085E 58                      		pop	ax
 10828                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10829 0000085F 9D                      		popf
 10830 00000860 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10831 00000862 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10832                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10833                                  
 10834                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10835 00000864 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10836                                  					; return error
 10837 00000866 F9                      		stc
 10838                                  
 10839                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10840                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10841                                  
 10842                                  okret2:					
 10843 00000867 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10844 0000086B 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10845 0000086F 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10846                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive

 10876 00000898 7404                    		jz	short exitjx	; watch	out for	wrap
 10877 0000089A 26FF4D20                		dec	word [es:di+20h]
 10878                                  exitjx:					
 10879                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10880                                  		; cf = 0
 10881                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10882                                  				; (19/07/2019 -	Erdogan	Tan - MSDOS 6.0	IO.SYS - retrodos4.s)
 10883 0000089E C3                      		retn

 10945                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10946                                  
 10947                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10948                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines.
 10949                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10950                                  
 10951                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10952                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10953                                  ;
 10954                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10955                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10956                                  
 10957                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10958                                  checksingle:
 10959 000008C9 50                      		push	ax
 10960 000008CA 53                      		push	bx
 10961 000008CB 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10962                                  
 10963                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10964                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10965                                  
 10966 000008CF F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10967 000008D2 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10968 000008D4 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10969                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10970 000008D7 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10971                                  
 10972                                  
 10973                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10974                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10975                                  
 10976 000008D9 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10977                                  					; get physical drive number
 10978 000008DD 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10979 000008DE 57                      		push	di
 10980 000008DF C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10981                                  scan_list:
 10982 000008E3 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10983 000008E7 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10984 000008E9 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10985 000008EB 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10986 000008EF 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10987 000008F1 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10988 000008F5 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10989 000008F6 07                      		pop	es
 10990 000008F7 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10991                                  
 10992                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10993                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10994                                  ; in this case.
 10995 000008FB 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10996 00000900 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10997                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10998 00000902 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10999 00000907 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 11000 00000909 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 11001                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 11002                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 11003 0000090D 06                      		push	es
 11004 0000090E 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 11005 00000912 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 11006                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 11007                                  					; set up sdsb
 11008 00000916 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 11009 00000917 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 11010                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11011                                  
 11012                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 11013                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 11014                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 11015                                  
 11016                                  not_fsetowner:
 11017 00000919 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 11018 0000091E 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 11019 00000920 50                      		push	ax
 11020 00000921 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 11021 00000925 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 11022 00000927 06                      		push	es
 11023 00000928 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 11024 0000092C 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 11025                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 11026                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 11027 00000931 07                      		pop	es
 11028 00000932 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 11029 00000934 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 11030 00000935 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 11031                                  ignore_sdsb:
 11032 00000937 E8480E                  		call	swpdsk
 11033 0000093A EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 11034                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11035                                  
 11036                                  scan_skip:
 11037 0000093C 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 11038                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 11039                                  					; go to	next bds
 11040 0000093F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 11041 00000942 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 11042 00000944 F9                      		stc
 11043 00000945 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 11044 00000946 07                      		pop	es
 11045                                  singleret:
 11046 00000947 5B                      		pop	bx
 11047 00000948 58                      		pop	ax

 11072                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11073                                  
 11074                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11075                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 11076                                  ;
 11077                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 11078                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 11079                                  ;	cx = sector count
 11080                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 11081                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 11082                                  ;	ds = cs
 11083                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 11084                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 11085                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 11086                                  ;
 11087                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 11088                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 11089                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11090                                  
 11091                                  diskrd:	
 11092                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 11093                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11094 0000094E C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 11095                                  
 11096                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11097                                  
 11098                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11099                                  diskio:
 11100 00000953 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 11101 00000955 8C06[2605]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 11102 00000959 E80EFC                  		call	SetDrive
 11103 0000095C 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 11104 00000960 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 11105                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 11106 00000963 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 11107                                  
 11108                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 11109                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 11110                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 11111                                  
 11112 00000965 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 11113                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 11114                                  					; unformatted_media
 11115 0000096A 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 11116 0000096C 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 11117 00000970 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 11118                                  
 11119                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 11120                                  
 11121 00000974 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 11122 00000976 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 11123 00000978 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 11124                                  		;adc	si, 0
 11125                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 11126 0000097A D1D6                    		rcl	si, 1
 11127 0000097C 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11128                                  					; 32 bit sector ?
 11129 00000981 740C                    		jz	short sanity32
 11130                                  		;cmp	si, 0
 11131                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11132 00000983 09F6                    		or	si, si
 11133 00000985 751A                    		jnz	short baddrive
 11134 00000987 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11135 0000098B 7714                    		ja	short baddrive
 11136 0000098D EB16                    		jmp	short sanityok
