 13617                                  
 13618                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13619                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13620                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13621                                  ;
 13622                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13623                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13624                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13625                                  ;	    drive)
 13626                                  ;
 13627                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13628                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13629                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13630                                  ;
 13631                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13632                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13633                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13634                                  ;
 13635                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13636                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13637                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13638                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13639                                  ;
 13640                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13641                                  ;
 13642                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13643                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13644                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13645                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13646                                  ; 
 13647                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13648                                  
 13649                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13650                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13651 000012D6 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13652 000012DA C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13653                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13654                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13655 000012DD 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13656 000012DF 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13657                                  		;
 13658 000012E1 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13659                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13660                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13661                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13662 000012E5 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13663                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13664 000012E7 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13665 000012E9 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13666 000012EB FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13667                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13668 000012ED FEC8                    		dec	al
 13669 000012EF 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13670 000012F1 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13671 000012F3 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13672 000012F5 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13673 000012F7 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13674 000012F9 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13675 000012FB 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13676                                  GotMediaType:				
 13677 000012FD 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13678                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13679                                  		; cf = 0
 13680                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13681 00001300 C3                      		retn
 13682                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13683                                  
 13684                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13685 00001301 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13686 00001304 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13687 00001306 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13688 00001308 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13689 0000130B 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13690                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13691 0000130D B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13692                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13693 0000130F B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13694 00001311 F9                      		stc
 13695 00001312 C3                      		retn
 13696                                  
 13697                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13698                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13699                                  		;db    0
 13700                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13701                                  
 13702                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13703                                  
 13704                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13705                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13706                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13707                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13708                                  
 13709                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13710                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13711                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13712                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13713                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13714                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13715                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13716                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13717                                  ;
 13718                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13719                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13720                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13721                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13722                                  ;
 13723                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13724                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13725                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13726                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13727                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13728                                  ;
 13729                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13730                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13731                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13732                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13733                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13734                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13735                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13736                                  
 13737                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13738                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13739                                  
 13740                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13741                                  
 13742                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13743 00001313 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13744 00001316 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13745 00001318 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13746 0000131B 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13747                                  
 13748                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13749                                  
 13750 0000131D 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13751 00001320 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13752 00001322 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13753 00001325 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13754 00001327 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13755                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13756                                  
 13757                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13758 0000132A CF                      		iret
 13759                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13760                                  
 13761                                  int2f_replace_int13:
 13762 0000132B 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13763 0000132C 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13764                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13765                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13766                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13767 0000132E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13768                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13769                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13770                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13771                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13772                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13773                                  		
 13774                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13775                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13776 00001333 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13777                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13778 00001337 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13779                                  
 13780                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13781                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13782                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13783                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13784                                  		
 13785                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13786                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13787 0000133B 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13788 0000133F A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13789                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13790                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13791 00001342 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13792 00001346 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13793                                  
 13794 0000134A 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13795                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13796                                  		;pop	bx
 13797 0000134B 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13798                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13799 0000134C 58                      		pop	ax
 13800                                  i2f_iret:
 13801 0000134D CF                      		iret
 13802                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13803                                  
 13804                                  mine:
 13805 0000134E 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions

 14000                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14001                                  
 14002                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14003                                  
 14004                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14005                                  ;
 14006                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14007                                  ;
 14008                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14009                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14010                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14011                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14012                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14013                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14014                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14015                                  ;
 14016                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14017                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14018                                  ;
 14019                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14020                                  
 14021                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14022                                  HMAPtr:
 14023 0000140E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14024                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14025 00001413 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14026                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14027 00001417 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14028 0000141A 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14029 0000141C 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14030                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14031 00001421 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14032 00001423 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14033                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14034 00001427 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14035                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14036                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14037 0000142B C3                      		retn
 14038                                  
 14039                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14040                                  
 14041                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14042                                  
 14043                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14044                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14045                                  
 14046                                  move_sector:
 14047                                  
 14048                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14049                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14050                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14051                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14052                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14053                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14054                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14055                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14056                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14057                                  ;
 14058                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14059                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14060                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14061                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14062                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14063                                  
 14064 0000142C FC                      		cld
 14065 0000142D 51                      		push	cx
 14066 0000142E B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14067 00001431 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14068 00001435 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14069 00001437 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14070 0000143B 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14071 0000143D F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14072 0000143F 59                      		pop	cx
 14073 00001440 C3                      		retn
 14074                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14075                                  
 14076                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14077 00001441 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14078 00001443 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14079 00001445 59                      		pop	cx
 14080 00001446 C3                      		retn
 14081                                  
 14082                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14083                                  
 14084                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14085                                  
 14086                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14087                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14088                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14089                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14090                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14091                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14092                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14093                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14094                                  ;
 14095                                  ; input conditions:
 14096                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14097                                  ;
 14098                                  ; output:
 14099                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14100                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14101                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14102                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14103                                  
 14104                                  check_wrap:	
 14105 00001447 50                      		push	ax
 14106 00001448 53                      		push	bx
 14107 00001449 06                      		push	es
 14108 0000144A 57                      		push	di
 14109 0000144B E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14110 0000144E 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14111                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14112 00001450 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14113                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14114 00001455 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14115 00001457 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14116 0000145B 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14117 0000145D 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14118 00001460 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14119 00001462 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14120 00001464 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14121                                  
 14122                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14123                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14124                                  
 14125 00001466 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14126 00001468 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14127                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14128 0000146A 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14129 0000146B 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14130                                  					; if on	boundary
 14131                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14132                                  not_on_bound:
 14133 0000146D 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14134 00001470 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14135 00001472 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14136 00001474 40                      		inc	ax
 14137 00001475 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14138 00001477 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14139                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14140 0000147A 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14141 0000147E 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14142                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14143                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14144 00001480 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14145 00001482 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14146 00001483 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14147                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14148 00001485 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14149                                  
 14150                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14151                                  
 14152 00001487 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14153 00001489 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14154 0000148B 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14155                                  
 14156                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14157                                  
 14158 0000148D 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14159 0000148F 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14160 00001491 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14161                                  no_head_bound:				
 14162 00001492 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14163 00001494 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14164 00001495 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14165 00001497 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14166 00001499 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14167 0000149B 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14168 0000149E B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14169 000014A0 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14170 000014A2 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14171 000014A4 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14172 000014A6 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14173 000014A8 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14174 000014AA 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14175 000014AC 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14176                                  no_wrap:				
 14177 000014AE F8                      		clc
 14178 000014AF 5F                      		pop	di
 14179 000014B0 07                      		pop	es
 14180 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14181 000014B2 58                      		pop	ax
 14182 000014B3 C3                      		retn
 14183                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14184                                  
 14185                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14186 000014B4 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14187 000014B6 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14188 000014B8 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14189                                  
 14190                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14191                                  
 14192                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14193                                  
 14194                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14195                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14196                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14197                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14198                                  ;
 14199                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14200                                  
 14201                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14202                                  find_bds:	
 14203 000014BA C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14204                                  fbds_1:					
 14205 000014BE 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14206 000014C2 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14207 000014C4 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14208                                  					; go to next bds
 14209 000014C7 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14210 000014CA 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14211 000014CC F9                      		stc
 14212                                  fdbs_2:					
 14213 000014CD C3                      		retn
 14214                                  
 14215                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14216                                  
 14217                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14218                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14219                                  doint:
 14220                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14221 000014CE 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14222                                  					; get physical drive number
 14223                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14224                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14225                                  		
 14226 000014D1 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14227 000014D3 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14228 000014D5 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14229                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14230 000014D7 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14231                                  					; get request code
 14232                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14233 000014DA FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14234                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14235 000014DD 9D                      		popf
 14236                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14237                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14238 000014DE 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14239                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14240                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14241 000014E3 9C                      		pushf
 14242                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14243 000014E4 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14244                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14245                                  dointdone:				
 14246 000014E7 C3                      		retn
 14247                                  
 14248                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14249                                  
 14250                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14251                                  
 14252                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14253                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14254                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14255                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14256                                  ;
 14257                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14258                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14259                                  ;
 14260                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14261                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14262                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14263                                  
 14264                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14265                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14266                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14267                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14268                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14269                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14270                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14271                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14272                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14273                                  ;end struc
 14274                                  
 14275                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14276                                  
 14277                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14278                                  ;	ah = function
 14279                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14280                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14281                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14282                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14283                                  ;   output conditions:
 14284                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14285                                  
 14286                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14287                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14288                                  ;
 14289                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14290                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14291                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14292                                  
 14293                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14294                                  
 14295                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14296                                  
 14297 000014E8 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14298                                  
 14299                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14300                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14301                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14302                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14303                                  
 14304                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14305                                  
 14306                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14307                                  
 14308                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14309                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14310                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14311                                  
 14312                                  format_special_stuff:
 14313 000014EC 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14314 000014F1 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14315 000014F3 53                      		push	bx
 14316 000014F4 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14317 000014F7 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14318 000014FA 5B                      		pop	bx
 14319 000014FB EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14320                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14321                                  
 14322                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14323                                  
 14324                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14325                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14326                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14327                                  
 14328                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14329                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 14330 000014FD 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14331 000014FF 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14332 00001501 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14333 00001502 51                      		push	cx
 14334 00001503 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14335 00001505 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14336 00001507 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14337 00001509 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14338 0000150D 59                      		pop	cx
 14339 0000150E 58                      		pop	ax
 14340 0000150F 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14341                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14342 00001511 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14343 00001512 06                      		push	es
 14344                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14345 00001513 2EC41E[E814]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14346                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14347                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14348 00001518 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14349 0000151A 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14350 0000151D 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14351                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14352                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14353 00001521 07                      		pop	es
 14354 00001522 5B                      		pop	bx
 14355 00001523 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14356                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14357                                  
 14358                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14359                                  
 14360                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14361                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14362                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14363                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14364                                  
 14365                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 14366 00001525 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14367                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14368 0000152A 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14369 0000152C 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14370                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14371 00001531 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14372                                  ps2_30_problem:
 14373 00001533 50                      		push	ax
 14374 00001534 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14375                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14376                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14377 00001536 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14378                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14379                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14380 0000153B 58                      		pop	ax
 14381 0000153C EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14382                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14383                                  
 14384                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14385                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14386                                  
 14387                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14388                                  
 14389                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14390                                  
 14391                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14392                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14393                                  
 14394                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14395 0000153E 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14396                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14397                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14398 0000153F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14399                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14400                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14401                                  
 14402                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14403                                  
 14404 00001544 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14405 00001547 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14406 0000154A 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14407                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14408                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 14409 0000154C 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14410 00001551 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14411                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14412                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14413                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 14414 00001553 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14415                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14416                                  		
 14417 00001558 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14418                                  		
 14419 00001559 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14420                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14421 0000155E 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14422                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14423                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 14424 00001560 9D                      		popf
 14425 00001561 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14426                                  ret_from_i13:
 14427 00001563 1F                      		pop	ds
 14428 00001564 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14429                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14430                                  
 14431                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14432                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14433                                  ; a changeline error.
 14434                                  
 14435                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 14436 00001567 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14437                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14438 00001569 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14439 0000156C 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14440 0000156E 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14441 00001570 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14442 00001572 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14443 00001577 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14444                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14445                                  					; never	would
 14446 00001579 53                      		push	bx
 14447 0000157A BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14448 0000157D E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14449 00001580 5B                      		pop	bx
 14450                                  int13b:
 14451 00001581 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14452 00001582 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14453                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14454                                  
 14455                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14456                                  
 14457                                  goterr13:
 14458 00001584 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14459 00001587 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14460                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 14461 00001589 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14462 0000158C 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14463 0000158E 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14464 00001593 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14465                                  
 14466 00001595 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14467                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14468                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14469                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14470 0000159A 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14471                                  
 14472 0000159C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14473                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14474                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14475 0000159E 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14476                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14477                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14478 000015A3 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14479 000015A6 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14480 000015A8 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14481 000015AA 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14482 000015AC 53                      		push	bx
 14483 000015AD 51                      		push	cx
 14484 000015AE 52                      		push	dx
 14485 000015AF A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14486                                  loop_ecc:
 14487 000015B2 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14488                                  
 14489                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14490                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14491                                  ;
 14492                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14493                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14494                                  ; track.
 14495                                  ;
 14496                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14497                                  ; this request.
 14498                                  ;
 14499                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14500                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14501                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14502                                  ;
 14503 000015B5 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14504                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14505                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14506 000015B8 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14507                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14508 000015BD 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14509 000015BF 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14510 000015C2 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14511 000015C4 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14512 000015C7 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14513                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14514                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14515                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14516 000015C9 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14517                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14518                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14519                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14520                                  ok11_op:
 14521 000015CB FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14522 000015CF 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14523 000015D1 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14524                                  					; add 200h to address
 14525 000015D3 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14526 000015D5 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14527 000015D7 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14528                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14529                                  
 14530                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14531                                  
 14532                                  ok11_exit_err:
 14533 000015D9 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14534                                  ok11_exit:
 14535 000015DA 5A                      		pop	dx
 14536 000015DB 59                      		pop	cx
 14537 000015DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 14538 000015DD EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14539                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14540                                  
 14541                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14542                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14543                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14544                                  
 14545                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 14546 000015DF 06                      		push	es
 14547 000015E0 53                      		push	bx
 14548 000015E1 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14549 000015E4 1E                      		push	ds
 14550 000015E5 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14551 000015E6 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14552                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14553                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14554 000015E9 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14555                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14556 000015EE 5B                      		pop	bx
 14557 000015EF 07                      		pop	es
 14558 000015F0 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14559 000015F2 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14560 000015F5 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14561                                  
 14562                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14563                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14564                                  
 14565                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 14566 000015F7 56                      		push	si
 14567 000015F8 57                      		push	di
 14568 000015F9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14569 000015FB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14570 000015FE E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14571 00001601 5F                      		pop	di
 14572 00001602 5E                      		pop	si
 14573 00001603 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14574                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14575                                  
 14576                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14577                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14578                                  
 14579                                  gotdmaerr:
 14580 00001605 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14581 00001608 FB                      		sti
 14582 00001609 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14583 0000160C 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14584                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14585                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14586 0000160E 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14587 00001611 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14588 00001613 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14589 00001616 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14590 00001618 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14591                                  
 14592                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14593                                  
 14594                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14595                                  
 14596 0000161A 52                      		push	dx
 14597 0000161B 51                      		push	cx
 14598 0000161C 53                      		push	bx
 14599 0000161D 50                      		push	ax
 14600 0000161E 55                      		push	bp
 14601 0000161F 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14602 00001621 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14603 00001623 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14604 00001625 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14605 00001627 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14606 00001629 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14607 0000162B 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14608 0000162D 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14609                                  
 14610                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14611                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14612                                  
 14613 00001631 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14614 00001633 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14615                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14616                                  
 14617                                  no_skip_first:
 14618 00001636 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14619 00001638 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14620 0000163A 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14621                                  
 14622                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14623                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14624                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14625                                  ;
 14626                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14627                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14628                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14629                                  ; in error.
 14630                                  
 14631 0000163C 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14632 0000163E 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14633                                  
 14634                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14635                                  
 14636 00001640 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14637                                  					; set up head number
 14638 00001643 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14639 00001646 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14640                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14641                                  
 14642                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 14643 00001649 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14644 0000164B F9                      		stc
 14645 0000164C E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14646                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14647                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14648                                  
 14649                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14650                                  
 14651                                  intverify:
 14652 0000164F 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14653 00001650 53                      		push	bx
 14654 00001651 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14655 00001652 07                      		pop	es
 14656                                  dosimple:
 14657 00001653 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14658                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14659                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14660                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14661 00001656 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14662                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14663 0000165B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14664 0000165C 07                      		pop	es
 14665 0000165D E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14666                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14667                                  
 14668                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14669                                  
 14670                                  intformat:
 14671 00001660 06                      		push	es
 14672 00001661 53                      		push	bx
 14673 00001662 56                      		push	si
 14674 00001663 57                      		push	di
 14675 00001664 1E                      		push	ds
 14676                                  
 14677                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14678                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14679                                  
 14680 00001665 06                      		push	es
 14681 00001666 1E                      		push	ds
 14682 00001667 07                      		pop	es
 14683 00001668 1F                      		pop	ds
 14684 00001669 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14685 0000166B BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14686 0000166E E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14687 00001671 1F                      		pop	ds
 14688 00001672 5F                      		pop	di
 14689 00001673 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14690 00001674 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14691                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14692                                  
 14693                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14694                                  ; the first block.
 14695                                  ;
 14696                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14697                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14698                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14699                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14700                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14701                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14702                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14703                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14704                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14705                                  
 14706                                  doblock:
 14707                                  
 14708                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14709                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14710                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14711                                  				
 14712 00001676 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14713                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14714 00001679 51                      		push	cx
 14715 0000167A 06                      		push	es
 14716 0000167B 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14717                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14718 0000167C E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14719 0000167F 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14720                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14721 00001683 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14722                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14723 00001688 5F                      		pop	di
 14724 00001689 07                      		pop	es
 14725 0000168A 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14726 0000168C 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14727 0000168E B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14728 00001690 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14729                                  doblockflop:
 14730 00001692 59                      		pop	cx
 14731                                  doblockcontinue:
 14732 00001693 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14733 00001695 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14734 00001697 50                      		push	ax
 14735 00001698 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14736 0000169A EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14737                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14738                                  
 14739                                  doblocklast:
 14740 0000169C 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14741 0000169E 50                      		push	ax
 14742                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 14743 0000169F E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14744 000016A2 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14745 000016A4 58                      		pop	ax
 14746 000016A5 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14747                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14748 000016A8 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14749 000016AA 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14750 000016AC 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14751 000016AE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14752 000016B0 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14753                                  					; then we are done already.
 14754 000016B2 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14755                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14756 000016B4 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14757 000016B7 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14758                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14759                                  
 14760                                  bufferx:
 14761 000016B9 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14762                                  					; set up head number
 14763                                  buffer:
 14764 000016BC 53                      		push	bx
 14765 000016BD 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14766 000016C0 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14767 000016C3 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14768                                  
 14769                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14770                                  
 14771 000016C5 06                      		push	es
 14772 000016C6 1E                      		push	ds
 14773 000016C7 56                      		push	si
 14774 000016C8 57                      		push	di
 14775 000016C9 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14776 000016CA 06                      		push	es
 14777 000016CB 1F                      		pop	ds
 14778 000016CC 07                      		pop	es
 14779 000016CD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14780 000016D0 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14781 000016D1 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14782 000016D3 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14783 000016D6 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14784                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14785 000016D7 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14786 000016D8 5E                      		pop	si
 14787 000016D9 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14788                                  
 14789                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14790                                  
 14791 000016DA B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14792                                  					; get drive number
 14793 000016DC 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14794 000016DF E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14795                                  					;
 14796                                  					; ah is	function
 14797                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14798                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14799                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14800                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14801                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14802 000016E2 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14803 000016E5 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14804 000016E6 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14805 000016E8 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14806                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14807                                  
 14808                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14809                                  
 14810                                  doread:
 14811 000016EA 06                      		push	es
 14812 000016EB 53                      		push	bx
 14813 000016EC 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14814 000016ED 07                      		pop	es
 14815 000016EE BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14816 000016F1 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14817 000016F3 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14818                                  					; get drive number
 14819 000016F6 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14820                                  					; ah = function
 14821                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14822                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14823                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14824 000016F9 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14825 000016FC 5B                      		pop	bx
 14826 000016FD 07                      		pop	es
 14827 000016FE 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14828 00001700 56                      		push	si
 14829 00001701 57                      		push	di
 14830 00001702 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14831 00001704 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14832 00001707 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14833 0000170A 5F                      		pop	di
 14834 0000170B 5E                      		pop	si
 14835                                  
 14836                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14837                                  
 14838                                  dotail:
 14839 0000170C 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14840 0000170D 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14841 00001710 41                      		inc	cx
 14842 00001711 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14843 00001714 F8                      		clc
 14844 00001715 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14845 00001717 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14846                                  
 14847                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14848                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14849                                  
 14850 00001719 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14851 0000171C E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14852 0000171F E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14853                                  
 14854                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14855                                  
 14856                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14857                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14858                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14859                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14860                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14861                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14862                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14863                                  
 14864                                  bad13:
 14865 00001722 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14866 00001724 5D                      		pop	bp
 14867 00001725 5B                      		pop	bx
 14868 00001726 5B                      		pop	bx
 14869 00001727 59                      		pop	cx
 14870 00001728 5A                      		pop	dx
 14871 00001729 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14872 0000172B E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14873                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14874                                  
 14875                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 14876 0000172E E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14877                                  
 14878                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14879                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14880                                  		;db 	0
 14881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14882                                  
 14883                                  ;Bios_Code ends
