 19808                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19809                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 19810                                  ;
 19811                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 19812                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 19813                                  ;
 19814                                  ; Inputs : None
 19815                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 19816                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 19817                                  ;	   free memory.
 19818                                  ;
 19819                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 19820                                  ;
 19821                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19822                                  	
 19823                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 19824                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:09A2h)
 19825                                  
 19826                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19827                                  AllocFreeMem:
 19828 000008DC BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19829 000008DF B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 19830 000008E1 CD21                    	int	21h			; first time fails
 19831 000008E3 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC

 19907                                  ;
 19908                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19909                                  ;
 19910                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19911                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19912                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19913                                  ;
 19914                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19915                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19916                                  ; 
 19917                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19918                                  
 19919                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 19928                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS

 19932                                  	; 11/12/2022

 20333                                  
 20334                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20335                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20336                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20337                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20338                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20339                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20340                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20341                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20342                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20343                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20344                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20345                                  ;
 20346                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20347                                  
 20348                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20349                                  update_arena:
 20350 00000A0A 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20351 00000A0B 57                      	push	di
 20352 00000A0C 51                      	push	cx
 20353 00000A0D 52                      	push	dx
 20354                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20355                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var

 20412                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20413                                  ;
 20414                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20415                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20416                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20417                                  ;
 20418                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20419                                  ;
 20420                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20421                                  
 20422                                  AllocHMA:
 20423                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20424                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20425                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20426                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20427                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.

 20434                                  ;	popf

 20581                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20582                                  ;
 20583                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20584                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20585                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20586                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20587                                  ;
 20588                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20589                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20590                                  ;
 20591                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20592                                  
 20593                                  StartVDHead:
 20594                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20595                                  
 20596 00000ACA 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20597 00000ACE 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20598 00000AD0 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20599 00000AD2 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20600 00000AD4 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20601                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20602 00000AD5 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20603                                  VDiskSig1:
 20604 00000ADC 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20605                                  
 20606                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20607                                  
 20608 00000AE1 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20609                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20610 00000AE7 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20611 00000AF6 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20612 00000AF8 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20613                                  VDInt19:
 20614 00000AF9 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20615                                  OldVDInt19:
 20616 00000AFA 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20617                                  
 20618                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20619                                  
 20620                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20621 00000AFE 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20622                                  VDiskSig2:
 20623 00000B01 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20624                                  
 20625                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20626                                  
 20627 00000B06 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20628 00000B09 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20629 00000B0B 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20630 00000B0C 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20631 00000B0E 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20632 00000B0F 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20633 00000B11 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20634 00000B13 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20635 00000B14 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20636 00000B16 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20637 00000B18 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20638 00000B1A 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20639 00000B1C 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20640                                  
 20641                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 20644                                  ;
 20645                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20646                                  ;
 20647                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20648                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20649                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20650                                  ;
 20651                                  ; Inputs : None
 20652                                  ;
 20653                                  ; Outputs : None
 20654                                  ;
 20655                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20656                                  ;
 20657                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20658                                  
 20659                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20660                                  
 20661                                  InstVDiskHeader:

 20672                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20673 00000B2C 2EA3[FC0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20674                                  
 20675                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20676                                  
 20677 00000B30 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20678                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20679                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20680 00000B32 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20681 00000B35 CD21                    	int	21h
 20682                                  
 20683                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20684                                  
 20685 00000B37 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20686 00000B38 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20687                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20688 00000B3A 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20689                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20690 00000B41 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20691 00000B48 40                      	inc	ax
 20692 00000B49 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20693                                  
 20694                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20695                                  
 20696 00000B4B FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20697                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20698 00000B4C C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20699 00000B52 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20700                                  
 20701                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20702

 20708 00000B5E 1F                      	pop	ds

 20714

 20786                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20787                                  
 20788                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20789                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20790                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20791                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20792                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20793                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20794                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20795                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20796                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20797                                  ;								     ;I070
 20798                                  ;	in      al,64h         		; Test for passwd servr mode ;I070
 20799                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070
 20800                                  ;	jnz     short ClrVDISKok	; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20801                                  ;					; Check for Tortugas...	     ;I070
 20802                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                	     ;I070
 20803                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20804                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]
 20805                                  ;	cmp	ax,19F8h
 20806                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20807                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070
 20808                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh			     ;I070
 20809                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh	
 20810                                  ;	cmp	ax,09FCh
 20811                                  ;	jne     short ClrVDISKok			      	     ;I070
 20812                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070	
 20813                                  ;	retn	               		; Return w/o block move.     ;I070
 20814                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20815                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20816                                  
 20817                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20818                                  	; ds = cs
 20819                                  
 20820                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20821                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20822                                  
 20823 00000BC6 06                      	push	es
 20824 00000BC7 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs

 20842 00000BDC 8816[8A0B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20843

 20845 00000BE3 0E                      	push	cs
 20846 00000BE4 07                      	pop	es

 20850                                  			; CX = number of words to move

 20856                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20857                                  ;
 20858                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20859                                  ;
 20860                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20861                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20862                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20863                                  ;		the offset.
 20864                                  ;
 20865                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20866                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20867                                  ;
 20868                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20869                                  
 20870                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 20871                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20872 00000BEE 1E                      	push	ds
 20873 00000BEF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20874 00000BF2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20875                                  	;
 20876 00000BF4 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20877 00000BF6 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20878                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20879 00000BF9 A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 20880                                  	;
 20881 00000BFC 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20882 00000BFE 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20883 00000C01 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20884 00000C04 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20885 00000C06 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20886 00000C08 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20887                                  	;
 20888                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20889                                  	;push	ds
 20890                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20891                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20892                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20893                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20894                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20895                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 20896 00000C0A 893E[8C08]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20897                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20898 00000C0E 1F                      	pop	ds
 20899 00000C0F C3                      	retn

 20901                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20902                                  ;
 20903                                  ; procedure : IsVDiskInstalled
 20904                                  ;
 20905                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 20906                                  ;		& INT 19 vector
 20907                                  ;
 20908                                  ; Inputs  : A20 flag should be ON
 20909                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared

 20940                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20941                                  ;
 20942                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20943                                  ;
 20944                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20945                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20946                                  ;
 20947                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20948                                  
 20949                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20950                                  CPMHack:
 20951 00000C37 1E                      	push	ds
 20952 00000C38 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20953 00000C3B 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = 0FFFFh
 20954                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20955                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20956 00000C3D 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20957 00000C3E 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20958 00000C40 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20959 00000C43 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20960                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20961 00000C46 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20962 00000C48 FC                      	cld
 20963 00000C49 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20964 00000C4B 1F                      	pop	ds
 20965 00000C4C C3                      	retn

 21882                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21883                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21884                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21885                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21886                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21887                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21888                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21889                                  ;
 21890                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21891                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21892                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21893                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21894                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21895                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21896                                  ;
 21897                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21898                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21899                                  ;
 21900                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21901                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21902                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21903                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21904                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21905                                  ;
 21906                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21907                                  ;
 21908                                  ;			  none.
 21909                                  
 21910                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21911                                  ;
 21912                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21913                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21914                                  
 21915                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21916

 22118                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22119                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22120                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 22121                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22122                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22123                                  ;
 22124                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22125                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22126                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22127                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22128                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22129                                  ; program).
 22130                                  
 22131                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22132                                  
 22133                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22134                                  
 22135 000010BD 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22136                                  
 22137                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22138                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22139                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22140                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22141                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22142                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22143                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22144                                  ; carridge return.
 22145                                  
 22146                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22147                                  ;character after =.
 22148                                  
 22149 000010BE 06                      	push	es
 22150 000010BF 1E                      	push	ds
 22151 000010C0 07                      	pop	es
 22152 000010C1 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22153 000010C2 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22154                                  
 22155 000010C4 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 22156 000010C6 FC                      	cld
 22157 000010C7 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22158 000010CD BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 22159                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 22160 000010D0 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 22161                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22162 000010D1 08C0                    	or	al,al
 22163                                  	;cmp	al,0
 22164 000010D3 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 22165 000010D5 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 22166                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 22167 000010D7 AC                      	lodsb
 22168 000010D8 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 22169 000010DB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 22170 000010DD 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 22171 000010DF FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 22172 000010E1 47                      	inc	di

 22292                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22293                                  ;
 22294                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22295                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22296                                  ;
 22297                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22298                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22299                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22300                                  
 22301                                  ParaRound:
 22302 0000113B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22303 0000113E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22304 00001140 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22305 00001142 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22306 00001144 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22307 00001146 C3                      	retn

 22309                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22310                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22311                                  ;
 22312                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22313                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22314                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22315                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22316                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22317                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22318                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22319                                  ;
 22320                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22321                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22322                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22323                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22324                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22325                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22326                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 22327                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22328                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22329                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22330                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22331                                  ;
 22332                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22333                                  
 22334                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22335                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22336                                  sysinit_base:				
 22337 00001147 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22338 0000114C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22339 00001151 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22340 00001153 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22341 00001158 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22342 0000115D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22343 0000115E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22344 0000115F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22345                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22346                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22347 00001161 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22348 00001164 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22349 00001169 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22350                                  
 22351                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22352                                  
 22353 0000116B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22354 0000116D 0E                      	push	cs
 22355 0000116E 1F                      	pop	ds
 22356                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22357                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22358                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22359 0000116F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22360                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22361 00001172 CD21                    	int	21h
 22362                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22363                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22364                                  
 22365                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22366                                  stall:
 22367                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22368                                  _stall: 
 22369                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22370 00001174 F4                      	hlt 
 22371                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22372                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22373 00001175 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22374                                  
 22375                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22376 00001177 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22377                                  
 22378                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22379                                  
 22380                                  sum_up:
 22381                                  
 22382                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22383                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22384                                  ;
 22385                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22386                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22387                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22388                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22389                                  ;
 22390                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22391                                  
 22392 0000117C 1E                      	push	ds
 22393                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22394                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22395 0000117D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22396                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22397                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22398 00001181 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22399 00001183 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22400 00001185 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22401 00001187 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22402                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22403 0000118C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22404 0000118E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22405                                  sum1:
 22406 00001190 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22407 00001192 46                      	inc	si
 22408 00001193 46                      	inc	si
 22409 00001194 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22410                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22411                                  sum_sys_code:
 22412                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22413 00001196 BE9611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22414                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22415                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22416                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22417                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22418                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22419                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22420                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22421 00001199 B9[604D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22422 0000119C 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22423 0000119E D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22424                                  sum2:
 22425 000011A0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22426 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 22427 000011A4 46                      	inc	si
 22428 000011A5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22429 000011A7 1F                      	pop	ds
 22430 000011A8 C3                      	retn
 22431                                  
 22432                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22433                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22434                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22435                                  
 22436                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22437                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22438 000011A9 0000                    	dw	0
 22439                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22440                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22441 000011AB 0000                    	dw	0

 22455                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22456                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22457                                  ;
 22458                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22459                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22460                                  ;
 22461                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22462                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22463                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22464                                  ;
 22465                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22466                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22467                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22468                                  
 22469                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22470                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 22471                                  
 22472                                  set_buffer:
 22473 000011C8 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22474 000011CA E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22475 000011CD 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 22476                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 22477                                  	; 17/09/2023
 22478 000011CF FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 22479                                  set_buff_1:
 22480                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22481                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 22482 000011D1 893F                    	mov	[bx],di

 22484 000011D3 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es

 22486 000011D6 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22487                                  
 22488 000011DB 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22489 000011DD 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22490 000011E2 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22491                                  
 22492                                  ;	for each buffer
 22493                                  
 22494                                  nxt_buff:
 22495 000011E3 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22496 000011E6 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 22497 000011E8 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 22498                                  
 22499 000011EA 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22500                                  
 22501 000011EF 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 22502                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22503 000011F0 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22504 000011F3 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22505                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22506                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22507 000011F5 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 22508                                  
 22509 000011F9 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 22510 000011FB 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 22511                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 22512 000011FD C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22513 00001201 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22514                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of scratch buff is 0
 22515 00001205 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 22516                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 22517 0000120A 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 22518 0000120D 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 22519                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 22520                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 22521                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 22522 00001211 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22523                                  set_buff_2:
 22524 00001214 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22525                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22526 00001219 2E800E[AD14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 22527                                  	;call	round
 22528                                  	;retn
 22529                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22530 0000121F E93D30                  	jmp	round

 22532                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22533                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22534                                  ;
 22535                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22536                                  ;
 22537                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22538                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22539                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22540                                  
 22541                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22542                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22543 00001222 53                      	push	bx
 22544 00001223 52                      	push	dx
 22545 00001224 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22546 00001228 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22547                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22548 0000122D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22549                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22550                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22551                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22552 00001230 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22553 00001232 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22554 00001234 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22555                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22556 00001237 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22557 00001239 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22558 0000123C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22559                                  
 22560                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22561                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22562                                  	; zf=1
 22563 0000123E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22564                                  	; zf=1
 22565                                  	
 22566                                  	;zf=1
 22567                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22568                                  	;zf=1
 22569 0000123F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22570                                  got_hma:
 22571 00001244 5A                      	pop	dx
 22572 00001245 5B                      	pop	bx
 22573 00001246 C3                      	retn

 22578                                  
 22579                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 22580                                  ;

 22582                                  ;    ax = di
 22583                                  ;
 22584                                  ;out:
 22585                                  ;    above entries set.

 22590 0000124C 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 22591 00001250 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 22592 00001254 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; adjust ax
 22593                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax

 22596 0000125C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22597                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22598 00001262 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22599                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22600 00001268 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22601 0000126E C3                      	retn

 22603                                  ; ======================================================================
 22604                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22605                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22606                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22607                                  
 22608                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22609                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22610                                  ;
 22611                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22612                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22613                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22614                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22615                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22616                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22617                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22618                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22619                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22620                                  ;
 22621                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22622                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22623                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22624                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22625                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22626                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22627                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22628                                  ;	conditions:
 22629                                  ;
 22630                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22631                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22632                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22633                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22634                                  ;
 22635                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22636                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22637                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22638                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22639                                  ;
 22640                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22641                                  ;
 22642                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22643                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22644                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22645                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22646                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22647                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22648                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22649                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22650                                  ;
 22651                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22652                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22653                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22654                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22655                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 22656                                  ;
 22657                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22658                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22659                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22660                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22661                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22662                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22663                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22664                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22665                                  ;
 22666                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22667                                  
 22668                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22669                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22670                                  
 22671                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22672                                  stackinit:
 22673 0000126F 50                      	push	ax
 22674 00001270 1E                      	push	ds
 22675 00001271 06                      	push	es
 22676 00001272 53                      	push	bx
 22677 00001273 51                      	push	cx
 22678 00001274 52                      	push	dx
 22679 00001275 57                      	push	di
 22680 00001276 56                      	push	si
 22681 00001277 55                      	push	bp
 22682                                  
 22683                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22684                                  
 22685                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22686                                  	; ds = cs
 22687 00001278 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22688 0000127B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22689                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22690                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22691                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22692 0000127D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22693                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22694 00001281 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22695 00001284 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22696                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22697 00001288 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22698                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22699                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22700                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22701 0000128B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22702                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22703 0000128F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22704 00001291 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22705                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22706                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22707                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22708 00001294 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22709                                  
 22710                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22711                                  
 22712                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22713                                  
 22714                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22715                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22716                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22717 00001298 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22718                                  
 22719                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22720                                  
 22721 0000129D B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22722                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22723                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22724                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22725 000012A0 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22726 000012A2 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22727 000012A4 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22728 000012A8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22729 000012AA 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22730                                  
 22731                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22732                                  
 22733 000012AD 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22734 000012B2 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22735 000012B6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22736 000012B8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22737 000012BA 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22738 000012BC 06                      	push	es
 22739 000012BD 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22740                                  
 22741                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22742                                  
 22743 000012BE 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22744 000012C2 FC                      	cld
 22745 000012C3 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22746                                  
 22747 000012C5 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22748                                  
 22749                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22750                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22751                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22752                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22753                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22754                                  
 22755                                  buildloop:
 22756                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22757                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22758                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22759                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free

 22781                                  	;mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte

 22785 000012F9 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 22786 000012FE 1F                      	pop	ds
 22787 000012FF 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 22788

 23510                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23511                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23512                                  
 23513                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23514                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23515                                  
 23516                                  new_init_loop:
 23517                                  
 23518                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23519                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23520                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23521                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23522                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23523                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23524                                  
 23525 00001461 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23526 00001464 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23527 00001466 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23528 0000146A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23529                                  
 23530 0000146D 1E                      	push	ds
 23531                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23532                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23533                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23534 0000146E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23535 00001471 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23536 00001473 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23537 00001476 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23538 00001478 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23539 0000147C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23540 0000147F 1F                      	pop	ds
 23541                                  
 23542 00001480 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23543 00001483 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23544 00001487 C3                      	retn
 23545                                  
 23546                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23547                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23548                                  
 23549                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23550                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23551                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23552                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23553                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23554                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23555                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23556                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23557                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23558                                  
 23559                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23560                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 23561                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23562                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 23563                                  
 23564                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 23565                                  
 23566                                  setdevmark:
 23567                                  
 23568                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23569                                  	;push	es
 23570                                  	;push	cx
 23571                                  
 23572 00001488 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 23573 0000148D 2E890E[AB14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 23574 00001492 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23575                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23576                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23577 00001494 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23578 00001498 41                      	inc	cx
 23579                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23580 00001499 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23581                                  
 23582                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23583                                  	;pop	cx
 23584                                  	;pop	es
 23585                                  	
 23586 0000149E 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 23587 000014A3 C3                      	retn
