 23788                                  
 23789                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23790                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23791                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23792                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23793                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23794                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23795                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23796                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23797                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23798                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23799                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23800                                  
 23801                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23802                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23803 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 23804 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 23805 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23806                                  endstruc
 23807                                  
 23808                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 23809                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 23810                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 23811                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 23812                                  
 23813                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23814                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 23815                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 23816                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 23817                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 23818                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23819                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23820                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 23821                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 23822                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 23823                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 23824                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23825                                  
 23826                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23827                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23828 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23829 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23830 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23831                                  endstruc
 23832                                  
 23833                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23834                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23835                                  ;
 23836                                  ;
 23837                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23838                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23839                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23840                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23841                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23842                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23843                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23844                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23845                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23846                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23847                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23848                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23849                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23850                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23851                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23852                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23853                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23854                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23855                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23856                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23857                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23858                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23859                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23860                                  ;	   :
 23861                                  ;
 23862                                  ;Note:
 23863                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23864                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23865                                  ;
 23866                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23867                                  ;
 23868                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23869                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23870                                  ;
 23871                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23872                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23873                                  ;
 23874                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23875                                  ;
 23876                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23877                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23878                                  ;
 23879                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23880                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23881                                  ;
 23882                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23883                                  ;
 23884                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23885                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23886                                  ;
 23887                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23888                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23889                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23890                                  ;
 23891                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23892                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23893                                  ;
 23894                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23895                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23896                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23897                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23898                                  
 23899                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23900                                  
 23901                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23902                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23903                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23904                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23905                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23906                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23907                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23908                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23909                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23910                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23911                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23912                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23913                                  
 23914                                  ;**** Function flags
 23915                                  
 23916                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23917                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23918                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23919                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23920                                  
 23921                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23922                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23923 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23924 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23925 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23926 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23927 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23928 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23929                                  endstruc
 23930                                  
 23931                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23932                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23933                                  ;
 23934                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23935                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23936                                  ;	     +-
 23937                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23938                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23939                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23940                                  ;	     |	:
 23941                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23942                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23943                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23944                                  ;	     |	:
 23945                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23946                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23947                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23948                                  ;	     +-	:
 23949                                  ;
 23950                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23951                                  ;
 23952                                  ;Note:
 23953                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23954                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23955                                  ;
 23956                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23957                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23958                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23959                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23960                                  
 23961                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23962                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23963                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23964                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23965                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23966                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23967                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23968                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23969                                  
 23970                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23971 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23972 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23973 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23974 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23975 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23976                                  endstruc
 23977                                  
 23978                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23979                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23980                                  ;
 23981                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23982                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23983                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23984                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23985                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23986                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23987                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23988                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23989                                  ;
 23990                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23991                                  ;
 23992                                  ;            +-
 23993                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23994                                  ;	    | or
 23995                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23996                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23997                                  ;	    | or
 23998                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23999                                  ;	    | or
 24000                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24001                                  ;	    | or
 24002                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24003                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24004                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24005                                  ;	    | or
 24006                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24007                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24008                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24009                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24010                                  ;	    +-
 24011                                  ;
 24012                                  ;
 24013                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24014                                  ;      list.
 24015                                  ;
 24016                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24017                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24018                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24019                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24020

 24026 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24027                                  endstruc

 24057                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error

 24140                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 24141                                  ; ======================================================================
 24142                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24143                                  
 24144                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24145                                  ; SysParse;
 24146                                  ;
 24147                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24148                                  ;
 24149                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24150                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24151                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24152                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24153                                  ;
 24154                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24155                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24156                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24157                                  ;
 24158                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24159                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24160                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24161                                  ;
 24162                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24163                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24164                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24165                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24166                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24167                                  ;
 24168                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24169                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24170                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24171                                  ;
 24172                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24173                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24174                                  ;
 24175                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24176                                  ;
 24177                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24178                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24179                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24180                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24181                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24182                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24183                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24184                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24185                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24186                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24187                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24188                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24189                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24190                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24191                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24192                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24193                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24194                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24195                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24196                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24197                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24198                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24199                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24200                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24201                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24202                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24203                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24204                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24205                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24206                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24207                                  
 24208                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24209                                  
 24210                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24211                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24212                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24213                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24214                                  
 24215                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24216                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24217                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24218                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24219                                  ;
 24220                                  
 24221                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24222                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24223                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24224                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24225                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24226                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24227                                  
 24228                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24229                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24230                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24231                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24232                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24233                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24234                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24235                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24236                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24237                                  
 24238                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24239                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24240                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24241                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24242                                  ;	     segment.
 24243                                  
 24244                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24245                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24246                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24247                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24248                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24249                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24250                                  
 24251                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 24252                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 24253                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 24254                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 24255                                  
 24256                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 24257                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 24258                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 24259                                  
 24260                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 24261                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove

 24264                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 24265                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 24266                                  
 24267                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 24268                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 24269                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 24270                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 24271

 24273                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.

 24841                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24842                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24843                                  ;
 24844                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24845                                  ;
 24846                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24847                                  ;	    AL = type
 24848                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24849                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24850                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24851                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24852                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24853                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24854                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24855                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24856                                  ;
 24857                                  ; Output:   None
 24858                                  ;
 24859                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24860                                  ;
 24861                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24862                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24863                                  
 24864                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24865 0000176B 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24866 0000176C 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 24867                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 24868 00001770 2E893E[B914]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 24869                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 24870                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 24871                                  	; 07/09/2023
 24872                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 24873 00001775 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 24874                                  
 24875 00001778 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 24954                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 24955                                  ;
 24956                                  ; Function:  Check the match_flags and make the exit code and set the
 24957                                  ;	     result buffer
 24958                                  ;
 24959                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 24960                                  ;		Complex

 24965                                  ;		Quoted String
 24966                                  ;		Simple String
 24967                                  ;
 24968                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24969                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 24972                                  ;
 24973                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format

 25080                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 25081                                  ;
 25082                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 25083                                  ;
 25084                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 25085                                  ;
 25086                                  ; Output:   None
 25087                                  ;
 25088                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS
 25089                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25090                                  
 25091                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 25092 00001898 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25093 00001899 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25094                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 25095 0000189A 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25096 0000189D 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25097 0000189F 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 25098                                  
 25099 000018A1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 25100 000018A3 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 25101                                  
 25102 000018A5 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 25103 000018AA 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 25104                                  
 25105 000018AC 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 25106 000018B0 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 25107                                  
 25108                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 25109 000018B2 E81204                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 25110 000018B5 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 25111                                  
 25112 000018B7 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 25113                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 25114 000018B8 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 25115 000018B9 EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25116                                  
 25117                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 25118 000018BB 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25119 000018BC 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25120 000018BD C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25122                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25123                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 25124                                  ;
 25125                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 25126                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 25127                                  ;
 25128                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 25129                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 25130                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 25131                                  ;
 25132                                  ; Output:   None
 25133                                  ;
 25134                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 25135                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25136                                  
 25137                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 25138 000018BE 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25139 000018BF 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25140 000018C0 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 25141                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 25142 000018C2 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 25143 000018C5 E8FF03                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 25144 000018C8 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 25145                                  
 25146 000018CA 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25147 000018CC 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 25148                                  
 25149 000018CE E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 25150 000018D1 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 25151 000018D4 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 25152                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 25153 000018D6 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 25154                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 25155 000018D7 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte
 25156 000018D8 EBE8                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25157                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 25158 000018DA 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25159 000018DB 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25160 000018DC C3                      	retn

 25256                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25257                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25258                                  ;
 25259                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25260                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25261                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25262                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25263                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25264                                  ;
 25265                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25266                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25267                                  ;
 25268                                  ; Output:    None
 25269                                  ;
 25270                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25271                                  ;
 25272                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25273                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25274                                  
 25275                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25276                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25277                                  
 25278                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25279                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25280                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25281 0000191A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25282 0000191B 2E800E[C114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25283 00001921 2E8026[C114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25284                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25285 00001927 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25286 0000192A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25287 0000192C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25288                                  
 25289 0000192E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25290 00001930 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25291                                  
 25292 00001932 2E800E[C114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25293                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25294 00001938 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25295                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25296 00001939 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25297 0000193C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25298 0000193D C3                      	retn
 25299                                  
 25300                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25301                                  
 25302                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25303                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 25304                                  
 25305                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25306                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 25307 0000193E 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25308 0000193F 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25309 00001940 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25310 00001941 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25311 00001942 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 25312 00001944 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 25313 00001946 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 25314                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 25315 00001947 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25316 0000194A 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 25317 0000194C 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 25318                                  
 25319 0000194E E8E000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 25320 00001951 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 25321                                  
 25322 00001953 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 25323 00001955 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 25324                                  
 25325                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25326                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 25327                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 25328                                  %if 0
 25329                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 25330                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25331                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25332                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25333                                  
 25334                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 25335                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 25336                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 25337                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25338                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25339                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25340                                  
 25341                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 25342                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25343                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25344                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25345                                  
 25346                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 25347                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 25348                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25349                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25350                                  
 25351                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 25352                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 25353                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25354                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25355                                  
 25356                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 25357                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25358                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 25359                                  %endif
 25360                                  ;****
 25361                                  %if 1
 25362                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25363                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2130h)
 25364

 25369 00001960 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 25370 00001962 E81500                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 25371 00001965 E81200                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 25372 00001968 01DA                    	add	dx,bx			; 8*(cx:dx)+2*(cx:dx) = 10*(cx:dx)
 25373 0000196A 11C1                    	adc	cx,ax
 25374 0000196C E80F00                  	call	_$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF

 25389 00001983 C3                      	retn

 25559                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25560                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25561                                  ;
 25562                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25563                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25564                                  ;
 25565                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25566                                  ;
 25567                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25568                                  ;
 25569                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25570                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25571                                  
 25572                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25573                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25574 00001A1F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25575 00001A20 2EF606[C114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25576 00001A26 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25577                                  
 25578 00001A28 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25579 00001A29 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25580                                  
 25581                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25582 00001A2A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25583 00001A2B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25584                                  
 25585 00001A2D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25586 00001A2E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25587                                  
 25588                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25589 00001A2F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25590 00001A30 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25593                                  ; _$P_0099;
 25594                                  ;
 25595                                  ; Function:  Make ASCII 0-9 to Binary 0-9
 25596                                  ;
 25597                                  ; Input:     AL = character code
 25598                                  ;
 25599                                  ; Output:    CY = 1 : AL is not number
 25600                                  ;	     CY = 0 : AL contains binary value
 25601                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25602                                  
 25603                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25604                                  %if 0
 25605                                  _$P_0099:
 25606                                  	cmp	al,"0"                  ;AN000;
 25607                                  	;jb	short _$P_0099Err	;AN000; must be 0 =< al =< 9
 25608                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25609                                  	jb	short _$P_0099Err2  ; cf=1
 25610                                  
 25611                                  	cmp	al,"9"                  ;AN000;
 25612                                  	ja	short _$P_0099Err	;AN000; must be 0 =< al =< 9
 25613                                  
 25614                                  	sub	al,"0"                  ;AN000; make char -> bin
 25615                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25616                                  	; cf=0	
 25617                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate no error
 25618                                  	retn				;AN000;
 25619                                  
 25620                                  _$P_0099Err:				;AN000;
 25621                                  	stc				;AN000; indicate error
 25622                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 12/12/2022	
 25623                                  	retn				;AN000;
 25624                                  %endif
 25625                                  
 25626                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25627                                  %if 1

 25631 00001A35 3C3A                    	cmp	al,"9"+1                ; cmp al,3Ah

 26211                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26212                                  ;
 26213                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26214                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26215                                  ;	    blanks.
 26216                                  ;

 26218                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26219                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List

 26222                                  ;	    SI points to the next character

 26224                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26225                                   
 26226                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26227                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26228                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26229                                  
 26230                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26231 00001C60 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26232 00001C61 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;

 26234                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26235                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh

 26239

 26242

 26244 00001C78 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26245                                  
 26246                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26247                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26248                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26249                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26250                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26251                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26252                                  %if 0
 26253                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26254                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26255                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26256                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26257

 26260

 26262                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26263                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26264                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26265                                  %endif
 26266                                  
 26267                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26268 00001C7A 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26269                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26270 00001C7F 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26271                                  
 26272                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26273 00001C81 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26274                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26275 00001C83 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26276                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26277                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26278                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26279                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26280 00001C87 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26281

 26312                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26313                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26314                                  ;
 26315                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26316                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26317                                  ;
 26318                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26319                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26320                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26321                                  ;
 26322                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set) if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26323                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26324                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26325                                  
 26326                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26327                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26328                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26329                                  ;
 26330                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26331                                  
 26332                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26333                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26334                                  
 26335                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26336                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26337                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26338                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26339 00001CAE BD[CA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26340                                  
 26341                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26342 00001CB1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26343 00001CB3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26344                                  
 26345                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26346 00001CB5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26347 00001CB7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26348                                  
 26349 00001CB9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26350                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26351                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26352 00001CBA C3                      	retn
 26353                                  
 26354                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26355                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26356                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26357                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26358                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26359                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26360                                  
 26361                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26362                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26363 00001CBB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26364 00001CBD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26365                                  
 26366 00001CBF 2E800E[C114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26367                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26368                                  
 26369                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26370                                  	; cf=0
 26371                                  	;retn
 26372                                  
 26373                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26374                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26375                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26376 00001CC5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26377                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26378                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26379 00001CC6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26381                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26382                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26383                                  ;
 26384                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26385                                  ;
 26386                                  ;  Input:
 26387                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26388                                  ;
 26389                                  ;  Output:
 26390                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26391                                  ;
 26392                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26393                                  ;
 26394                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26395                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26396                                  
 26397                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26398 00001CC7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26399 00001CC8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26400 00001CC9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)

 26402                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;

 26404 00001CCA 2E8B36[BE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26405 00001CCF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26406 00001CD1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26407 00001CD3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26408 00001CD4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26409 00001CD5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26410 00001CD6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26411 00001CD7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26412 00001CD8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26413 00001CD9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26414                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26415                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26416 00001CDA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26417 00001CDC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26418 00001CDF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26419                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26420 00001CE1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26421 00001CE3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26422 00001CE5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26423 00001CE6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26424 00001CE7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26425 00001CE8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26426 00001CE9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26427 00001CEA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26428 00001CEB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26429 00001CEC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26430                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26431 00001CEE 2E8936[BC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26432 00001CF3 2E891E[BE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26433                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26434                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26435                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26436                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26437 00001CF8 2EC536[BC14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26438                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26439 00001CFD 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26440 00001D00 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26441 00001D02 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26442 00001D04 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26443 00001D06 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26444 00001D09 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26445 00001D0B F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26446 00001D0C EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26447                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;

 26449 00001D0F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26450                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26451 00001D10 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26452                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26453                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26454                                  	; cf=0
 26455                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26456                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;

 26481 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??

 26483 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer

 26486                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation

 26489 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 26490                                  .size:
 26491                                  endstruc

 26495 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 26496 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 26497 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 26498 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 26499                                  .size:
 26500                                  endstruc

 27025                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27026                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27027                                  
 27028                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27029                                  ;
 27030                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27031                                  ;
 27032                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27033                                  ;
 27034                                  ;   Modification log:
 27035                                  ;
 27036                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27037                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27038                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27039                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27040                                  ;
 27041                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27042                                  ;
 27043                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27044                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27045                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27046                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27047                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27048                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27049                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27050                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27051                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27052                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27053                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27054                                  ;
 27055                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27056                                  
 27057                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27058                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27059                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27060                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27061                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27062                                  
 27063                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27064                                  
 27065                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27066                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27067                                  
 27068                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27069                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27070                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27071                                  
 27072                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27073                                  ;
 27074                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27075                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27076                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 if the user has specified /S on the command-
 27077                                  ;	           line.
 27078                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27079                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27080                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27081                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27082                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27083                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27084                                  ;	          will be set to 1. All others will be set to 0.
 27085                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27086                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27087                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27088                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27089                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27090                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27091                                  ;	           for details).
 27092                                  
 27093 00001F15 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27094 00001F16 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27095 00001F17 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27096 00001F19 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27097 00001F1A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27098 00001F2A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27099 00001F4A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27100 00001F4B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27101 00001F4C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27102                                  
 27103                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27104                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27105                                  
 27106                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27107                                  
 27108                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27109

 27119

 27121 00001F4F 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27122 00001F51 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27123 00001F53 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27124 00001F57 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver

 27128                                  ;

 27130 00001F5D 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; current UMB used for loading devices (paras)
 27131 00001F5F 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 27132 00001F61 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free mem blk in the current UMB (paras)
