 27164                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27165                                  ;
 27166                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27167                                  ;
 27168                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27169                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 27170                                  ;
 27171                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27172                                  
 27173                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27174                                  doconf:
 27175 00001F81 0E                      	push	cs
 27176 00001F82 1F                      	pop	ds
 27177                                  
 27178 00001F83 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 27179                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 27180 00001F86 CD21                    	int	21h
 27181 00001F88 8816[2A46]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 27182                                  
 27183                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 27184                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27185                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27186                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 27187 00001F8C 8816[2846]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 27188                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27189                                  
 27190 00001F90 BA[3F45]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ; now pointing to file description
 27191 00001F93 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 27192                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		; open file "config.sys"
 27193 00001F96 F9                      	stc				; in case of int 24h
 27194 00001F97 CD21                    	int	21h			; function request
 27195 00001F99 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 27196                                  
 27197                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27198                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27199                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27200 00001F9B E8F418                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 27201                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 27202                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 27203 00001F9E C606[CD02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 27204 00001FA3 C3                      	retn
 27205                                  noprob: 				; get file size (note < 64k!!)
 27206 00001FA4 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 27207 00001FA6 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; 0
 27208 00001FA8 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; 0
 27209                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 27210 00001FAA B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 27211 00001FAD CD21                    	int	21h
 27212 00001FAF A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax		; dx:ax = file size ; 08/09/2023
 27213                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 27214 00001FB2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 27215                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 27216                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.
 27217                                  					; ((Also PCDOS 7.1 has 'xor dx,dx' here))
 27218                                  					; (Error will be same if CONGIG.SYS file
 27219                                  					;  size > 64KB) 
 27220                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 27221 00001FB4 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 27222 00001FB7 CD21                    	int	21h
 27223                                  
 27224                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 27225 00001FB9 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 27226                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27227                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27228                                  
 27229 00001FBD A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27230 00001FC0 A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27231 00001FC3 E875F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27232 00001FC6 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27233                                  
 27234                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27235                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27236                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27237                                  ;
 27238                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27239                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27240                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27241                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27242                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27243                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27244                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27245                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27246                                  ;
 27247 00001FC8 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27248 00001FC9 8916[A614]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27249 00001FCD 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27250                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27251                                  
 27252 00001FCF 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27253                                  	
 27254                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27255 00001FD2 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27256 00001FD6 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27257                                  	
 27258                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27259                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27260                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 27261                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27262                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27263                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27264                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]	
 27265                                  
 27266                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27267                                  	; ds = cs
 27268 00001FDA 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27269                                  
 27270 00001FDE 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27271 00001FE0 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27272                                  
 27273 00001FE2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27274                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27275                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27276 00001FE4 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27277                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27278 00001FE6 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27279 00001FE7 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27280 00001FE9 9C                      	pushf
 27281                                  
 27282                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27283                                  
 27284 00001FEA 50                      	push	ax
 27285 00001FEB 57                      	push	di
 27286 00001FEC 51                      	push	cx
 27287 00001FED B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27288 00001FEF 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27289 00001FF1 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27290 00001FF3 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27291 00001FF5 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27292                                  
 27293                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27294                                  
 27295 00001FF7 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27296                                  
 27297                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27298                                  
 27299                                  puteol:
 27300 00001FF8 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27301 00001FFA AA                      	stosb
 27302 00001FFB B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27303 00001FFD AA                      	stosb
 27304 00001FFE 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27305                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27306                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27307                                  
 27308                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27309                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27310 00002000 0E                      	push	cs
 27311 00002001 1F                      	pop	ds
 27312                                  
 27313 00002002 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 27314                                  
 27315 00002006 59                      	pop	cx
 27316 00002007 5F                      	pop	di
 27317 00002008 58                      	pop	ax
 27318                                  
 27319                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27320                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27321                                  	;push	cs
 27322                                  	;pop	ds
 27323                                  
 27324 00002009 50                      	push	ax
 27325                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 27326 0000200A B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 27327 0000200C CD21                    	int	21h
 27328 0000200E 58                      	pop	ax
 27329 0000200F 9D                      	popf
 27330 00002010 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;we've got a problem
 27331 00002012 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax			; if ax <(>) cx
 27332 00002014 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 27333                                  conferr:
 27334 00002016 BA[3F45]                	mov	dx,config		;print config error
 27335 00002019 E87924                  	call	badfil
 27336                                  	; 17/09/2023
 27337                                  endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 27338 0000201C C3                      	retn
 27339

 27342                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 27343                                  ;
 27344                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands

 27416 00002067 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27417 00002068 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27418 0000206B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error

 27423                                  ;
 27424                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27425                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27426                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27427                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27428                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27429                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27430                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27431                                  ;   spot.
 27432                                  ;
 27433                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27434                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27435                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27436                                  ;   retrieved.

 27636                                  
 27637                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27638                                  ;									      *
 27639                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27640                                  ;									      *
 27641                                  ; input :								      *
 27642                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27643                                  ; output:								      *
 27644                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27645                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27646                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27647                                  ;									      *
 27648                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27649                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27650                                  ; logic:								      *
 27651                                  ; {									      *
 27652                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27653                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27654                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27655                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27656                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27657                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27658                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27659                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27660                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27661                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27662                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27663                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27664                                  ;	};								      *
 27665                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27666                                  ; };									      *
 27667                                  ;									      *
 27668                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27669                                  
 27670                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27671                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27672                                  tryb:
 27673 00002142 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27674 00002145 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 27675                                  
 27676                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27677                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 27678                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27679                                  ;%if 0
 27680                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27681 00002147 E83F1F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 27682 0000214A 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27683                                  ;endif
 27684                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27685                                  
 27686                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27687                                  	; 18/12/2022
 27688 0000214C 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27689                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 27690 0000214E 880E[5D1D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 27691

 27694                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27695                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27696                                  do7:

 27699                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.

 27705 0000215A E9A606                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27706                                  if7:
 27707 0000215D 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 27708 00002160 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 27709                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x ; (/X switch)
 27710 00002162 813E[611D][561D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 27711                                  	;jne	short if11

 27716                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022

 27740 0000218C EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 27741                                  if18:
 27742 0000218E A1[591D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.

 27759                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27760                                  ; break command
 27761                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27762                                  
 27763                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27764                                  ;									    *
 27765                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27766                                  ;									    *
 27767                                  ; input :								    *
 27768                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27769                                  ; output:								    *
 27770                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27771                                  ;									    *
 27772                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27773                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27774                                  ; logic:								    *
 27775                                  ; {									    *
 27776                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27777                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27778                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27779                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27780                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27781                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27782                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27783                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27784                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27785                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27786                                  ;	};								    *
 27787                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27788                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 27789                                  ; };									    *
 27790                                  ;									    *
 27791                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27792                                  
 27793                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27794                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 27795                                  tryc:
 27796 000021A3 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 27797 000021A6 7539                    	jne	short trym
 27798                                  
 27799                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27800                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 27801                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27802                                  ;%if 0

 27850                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27851                                  ; multitrack command
 27852                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27853                                  
 27854                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27855                                  ;									      *
 27856                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 27857                                  ;									      *
 27858                                  ; input :								      *
 27859                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27860                                  ; output:								      *
 27861                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 27862                                  ;									      *
 27863                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27864                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27865                                  ; logic:								      *
 27866                                  ; {									      *
 27867                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 27868                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27869                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27870                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27871                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27872                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 27873                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 27874                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 27875                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 27876                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 27877                                  ;	};								      *
 27878                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 27879                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *
 27880                                  ;									      *
 27881                                  ; };									      *
 27882                                  ;									      *
 27883                                  ;******************************************************************************

 29373                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29374                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29375                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29376                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29377                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29378                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29379                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29380                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29381                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29382                                  
 29383                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29384                                  ;									  *
 29385                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29386                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29387                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29388                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29389                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29390                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29391                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29392                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29393                                  ; input :								  *
 29394                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29395                                  ; output:								  *
 29396                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29397                                  ;									  *
 29398                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29399                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29400                                  ; logic:								  *
 29401                                  ; {									  *
 29402                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29403                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29404                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29405                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29406                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29407                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29408                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29409                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29410                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29411                                  ;	     }								  *
 29412                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29413                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29414                                  ;	};								  *
 29415                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29416                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29417                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29418                                  ; };									  *
 29419                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30166                                  sysinit_parse:
 30167                                  
 30168                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30169                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 30170                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 30171                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 30172                                  ;
 30173                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30174                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30175                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30176                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30177                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30178                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30179                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30180                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30181                                  ;	 procedure.
 30182                                  ;	ax - exit code
 30183                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 30184                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 30185                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 30186                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 30187                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30188                                  
 30189                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30190                                  	; (SYSINIT:2D78h)
 30191

 30534                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30535                                  ;
 30536                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30537                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30538                                  ;
 30539                                  ;	Output : none

 30542                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30543                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30544                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30545                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 30557                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30558                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30559                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30560                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12h as end of UMB

 30575                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30576                                  ;
 30577                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30578                                  ;
 30579                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30580                                  ;	Output : none
 30581                                  ;
 30582                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30583                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30584                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30585                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30586                                  ;
 30587                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30588                                  
 30589                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30590                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30591 0000298B 1E                      	push	ds
 30592 0000298C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30593 0000298F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30594 00002991 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30595 00002995 2E891E[6F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30596 0000299A B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30597 0000299C D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30598 0000299E A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30599 000029A1 2EC606[6E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30600 000029A7 1F                      	pop	ds
 30601                                  ;limx:
 30602 000029A8 C3                      	retn
 30603

 30605                                  ;
 30606                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30607                                  ;
 30608                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30609                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30610                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30611                                  ;

 30613                                  ;

 30615                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying

 30627                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30628 000029B0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30629 000029B3 8826[6E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0

 30692                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30693                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30694                                  
 30695                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30696                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30697                                  
 30698                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30699                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30700                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30701                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30702                                  
 30703                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30704                                  ;
 30705                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30706                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30707                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30708                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30709                                  ;
 30710                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30711                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30712                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30713                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30714                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30715                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30716                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30717                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30718                                  ; available during the load.
 30719                                  ;
 30720                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30721                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30722                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30723                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30724                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30725                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30726                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30727                                  ;
 30728                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30729                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30730                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30731                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30732                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30733                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30734                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30735                                  ;
 30736                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30737                                  
 30738                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30739                                  
 30740                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30741                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30742                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30743                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30744                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30745                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30746                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30747                                  
 30748                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30749                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30750                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30751                                  
 30752                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30753                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30754                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30755                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30756                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30757                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30758                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30759                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30760                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30761                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30762                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30763                                  
 30764                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 30796                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB

 30822                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30823                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30824                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30825                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30826                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30827                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30828                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30829                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30830                                  
 30831                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30832                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30833                                  FixMem:
 30834                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30835                                  	;push	ax
 30836                                  	;push	bx
 30837                                  	;push	cx
 30838                                  	;push	dx
 30839 00002A15 06                      	push	es
 30840                                  
 30841 00002A16 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30842                                  
 30843 00002A19 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30844 00002A1C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30845                                  
 30846 00002A1E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30847                                  
 30848                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30849                                  
 30850 00002A20 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30851 00002A22 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30852 00002A24 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30853                                  
 30854                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30855                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30856                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30857                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30858                                  
 30859 00002A25 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30860 00002A29 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30861 00002A2E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30862 00002A30 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30863                                  
 30864                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30865                                  
 30866 00002A32 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30867 00002A37 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30868 00002A39 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30869                                  
 30870 00002A3D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30871                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30872                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30873 00002A42 43                      	inc	bx
 30874 00002A43 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30875                                  
 30876                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30877                                  
 30878 00002A48 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Save MCB address
 30879 00002A4A 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30880                                  
 30881 00002A4F 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30882                                  	;add	bx,[es:3]
 30883 00002A51 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30884 00002A56 43                      	inc	bx
 30885 00002A57 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30886                                  
 30887                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30888 00002A59 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30889 00002A5B 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30890                                  fmX:	
 30891 00002A5D E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30892                                  
 30893 00002A60 07                      	pop	es
 30894                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30895                                  	;pop	dx
 30896                                  	;pop	cx
 30897                                  	;pop	bx
 30898                                  	;pop	ax
 30899                                  
 30900 00002A61 C3                      	retn
 30901                                  
 30902                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30903                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30904                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30905                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30906                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30907                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30908                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30909                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30910                                  
 30911                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30912                                  fm_link:
 30913 00002A62 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30914 00002A65 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30915                                  
 30916                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30917                                  	;
 30918                                  	;push	es
 30919                                  	;push	cs
 30920                                  	;pop	es
 30921                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30922                                  	;pop	es
 30923                                  	
 30924                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30925                                  	; ds = cs
 30926                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30927 00002A67 A2[4A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30928                                  
 30929 00002A6A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30930 00002A6D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30931 00002A70 CD21                    	int	21h
 30932 00002A72 C3                      	retn
 30933                                  
 30934                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30935                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30936                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30937                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30938                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30939                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30940                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30941                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30942                                  
 30943                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30944                                  fm_unlink:
 30945 00002A73 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30946                                  	
 30947                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30948                                  	;
 30949                                  	;push	ds
 30950                                  	;push	cs
 30951                                  	;pop	ds
 30952                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30953                                  	;pop	ds
 30954                                  	
 30955                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30956                                  	; ds = cs
 30957                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30958 00002A75 8A1E[4A1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 30959                                  
 30960 00002A79 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30961 00002A7C CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30962 00002A7E C3                      	retn
 30963                                  
 30964                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30965                                  
 30966                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30967                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30968                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30969                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30970                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30971                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30972                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30973                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30974                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30975                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30976                                  ;
 30977                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30978                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30979                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30980                                  ;
 30981                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30982                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30983                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30984                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30985                                  ;
 30986                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30987                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30988                                  ;
 30989                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30990                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30991                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30992                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30993                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30994                                  ;     lh
 30995                                  ;     /l
 30996                                  ;     1
 30997                                  ;     1000
 30998                                  ;     2
 30999                                  ;     print
 31000                                  ;     /d
 31001                                  ;     :lpt2
 31002                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31003                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31004                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31005                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31006                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31007                                  ; for:
 31008                                  ;    Each /L
 31009                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31010                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31011                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31012                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31013                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31014                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31015                                  
 31016                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31017                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31018                                  
 31019                                  ParseVar:
 31020                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31021                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31022                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31023 00002A7F 1E                      	push	ds
 31024 00002A80 06                      	push	es
 31025                                  
 31026 00002A81 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31027 00002A82 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31028 00002A83 FC                      	cld
 31029                                  
 31030                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31031                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31032                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31033                                  
 31034 00002A84 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31035 00002A85 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31036 00002A88 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31037                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31038 00002A8A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31039 00002A8C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31040                                  
 31041 00002A8E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31042 00002A8F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31043 00002A90 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31044                                  pv20:	
 31045 00002A92 AC                      	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31046                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31047 00002A93 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31048                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31049 00002A95 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31050 00002A97 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31051                                  
 31052                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31053 00002A99 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31054                                  
 31055                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31056                                  	;
 31057                                  	;push	es
 31058                                  	;push	cs
 31059                                  	;pop	es
 31060                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31061                                  	;pop	es
 31062                                  
 31063 00002A9E 2EC606[161F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31064                                  
 31065 00002AA4 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31066                                  
 31067                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31068 00002AA6 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then it's a bad
 31069 00002AA8 750D                    	jne	short pvE1	; switch!
 31070                                  
 31071                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31072 00002AAA 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31073                                  
 31074 00002AAF E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31075 00002AB2 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31076                                  
 31077 00002AB4 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31078 00002AB5 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31079                                  
 31080                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31081 00002AB7 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31082 00002ABA 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31083 00002ABB 4E                      	dec	si
 31084 00002ABC F9                      	stc
 31085                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31086 00002ABD 07                      	pop	es
 31087 00002ABE 1F                      	pop	ds
 31088                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31089                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31090 00002ABF C3                      	retn
 31091                                  
 31092                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31093                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31094                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31095                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31096                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31097                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31098                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31099                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31100                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31101                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31102                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax. The 3-character rewind
 31103                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31104                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31105                                  
 31106                                  parseL:
 31107 00002AC0 AC                      	lodsb
 31108 00002AC1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31109 00002AC3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31110                                  
 31111                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31112                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31113                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31114                                  
 31115 00002AC5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, it's ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31116 00002AC8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31117 00002ACA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31118                                  
 31119 00002ACD 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31120 00002ACF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31121 00002AD2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31122                                  
 31123                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31124 00002AD4 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31125                                  
 31126 00002AD9 AC                      	lodsb
 31127 00002ADA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31128 00002ADC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31129                                  
 31130 00002ADE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31131 00002AE1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31132                                  
 31133 00002AE3 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31134 00002AE6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31135                                  
 31136                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31137 00002AE8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31138 00002AEA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31139                                  
 31140 00002AEC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31141 00002AEE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31142                                  
 31143                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31144                                  
 31145 00002AF0 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31146 00002AF3 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31147                                  
 31148 00002AF5 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31149                                  
 31150 00002AF8 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31151                                  
 31152                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31153 00002AFB 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31154                                  
 31155 00002B00 AC                      	lodsb
 31156 00002B01 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31157 00002B03 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31158                                  
 31159 00002B05 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31160 00002B08 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31161                                  
 31162 00002B0A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31163 00002B0D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31164                                  
 31165                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31166 00002B0F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31167 00002B11 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31168                                  plE1:	
 31169                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31170 00002B13 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31171 00002B16 4E                      	dec	si
 31172 00002B17 F9                      	stc
 31173 00002B18 C3                      	retn
 31174                                  
 31175                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 31176 00002B19 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 31177                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31178                                  	; cf=1
 31179                                  	;stc
 31180 00002B1C C3                      	retn
 31181                                  plSwX:	
 31182 00002B1D 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 31183                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 31184                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 31185                                  	; cf=0
 31186                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 31187 00002B1E C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 31188                                  
 31189                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31190                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 31191                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31192                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 31193                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31194                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31195                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 31196                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31197                                  
 31198                                  ;incArgc:

 31215                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31216                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31217                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31218                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31219                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31220                                  ; USES:     ZF

 31225 00002B21 7406                    	je	short ieX

 31227 00002B25 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31228 00002B27 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31229                                  ieX:

 31245 00002B30 7402                    	je	short iwX

 31247                                  iwX:

 31301                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31302                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31303                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31304                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31305                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31306                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31307                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31308                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31309                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31310                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31311                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31312                                  
 31313                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31314                                  stowUMB:
 31315 00002B48 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31316 00002B4A 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31317 00002B4C F9                      	stc
 31318 00002B4D C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB # >= MAXUMB
 31319                                  su10:	
 31320                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31321                                  	;push	bx
 31322                                  	;push	di
 31323                                  	;push	si
 31324                                  	;push	ds
 31325                                  	;push	es
 31326                                  	;push	cs
 31327                                  	;pop	es
 31328                                  	;push	cs
 31329                                  	;pop	ds
 31330                                  
 31331                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31332                                  	; ds <> cs
 31333                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31334 00002B4E 2E803E[191F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31335                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31336 00002B54 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31337 00002B56 2EA2[191F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31338                                  
 31339                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31340                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31341                                  	;jne	short su20
 31342                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31343                                  su20:	
 31344 00002B5A 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31345 00002B5C 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 31346                                  
 31347                                  	;mov	bl,al
 31348                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 31349                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 31350                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31351 00002B5E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 31352 00002B60 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 31353 00002B62 B001                    	mov	al,1
 31354                                  
 31355                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31356                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31357 00002B64 2E8687[1A1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31358                                  
 31359                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 31360                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 31361                                  	;
 31362                                  	;stc			; OOOPS! This one's been used before. :(
 31363                                  	
 31364                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31365 00002B69 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 31366 00002B6B F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 31367                                  su30:	
 31368                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31369                                  	;pop	es
 31370                                  	;pop	ds
 31371                                  	;pop	si
 31372                                  	;pop	di
 31373                                  	;pop	bx
 31374 00002B6C C3                      	retn
